title: Calories in 2 Pieces of Bacon
meta_description: Discover calories in 2 pieces of bacon, including fat, protein, sodium details, per-piece basis, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard pork bacon strips, pan-fried until crisp, drained of excess fat; ~8 g per uncooked piece, cooked weight ~6 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut thickness, cooking method, and fat drainage. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two pieces of cooked bacon offer ~86 kcal, mostly from fat, with ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use turkey bacon instead per piece
Add 1 tsp maple syrup glaze per piece

faqs.q: How many calories in one piece of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal per cooked pork bacon strip.

faqs.q: What makes bacon high in sodium?
faqs.a: Curing process adds salt; two pieces have ~384 mg sodium.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”frying retains more fat than baking or microwaving with drainage.

faqs.q: How much fat is in 2 pieces of bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 6.6 g total fat, including 2.2 g saturated.
Turkey or plant-based bacon can be 20-30 kcal lower per piece.
